div.p: Recieved your most welcome letter of Jan 4- yesterday I only got two letters last week one from you and the other from mother

We have had a snow this week and is still on the ground The roads are slick as glass I am like one of the boys said last night. the only time I am in the road is when I cross from one side to the other If I dont quit fussing so much abot the weather over here i know you will think I am a regular old grouch
But I have just go to fuss about something so I take it out on the weather.
I hope your eyes are alright by this time.

I know you called me out when they were hurting so bad and I dont blame you a bit. Well when I get home I sure will do some calling out for I have told my people to never have any of my letters published in the paper.
I dont think my name looks good in the paper.

I say there has been plenty of flue in the States. Looks like never will leave I am sure glad we didnt have it to contend with over here Maybe if the weather continues Cold will stop that awful flue. They must have put on quite
Say did he ever come accross over here. I dont see how he got home so quick if he did

I saw Ernest Warlick the other day, I dont know wherether you know him or not. Say you know him anyway. Company is here in town with me I found the company the othere day but he is in the hospital So I dont get to see him I was awful sorry for when I found out he was in town (or his company) I thought I would get to see him
I didnt find out what was the matter with him. If he got back any way soon I will see him I guess. I hope so any way

I can find out where Prvt Leroy is I have looked for the place on the map but havent found it yet. Must be a small town. Well news is real scarce so will quit for this time hopeing to here from you again real soon
P. S. You should hear the argument here now Some one has started the report that we will be on our way home in 60 days I dont know but dont think there is any truth to the report
